JP: 保存食屋で生産できる卵の壺漬け。貿易品としてトレード可能。
KR: 보존 식품 주방에서 만든 달걀 절임입니다. 거래에 사용됩니다.
FR: Œufs vinaigrés de la conserverie. Pour commercer.

JP: 強化板
鉄の彫刻
卵の壺漬け
氷の島の旅人

EN: Hi! Name's Oleg. Me and the family were on a sea trip when we hit an exhausting storm. Mind if we rest here? My clavicle is killing me.
JP: やあ！わしはオレグという者じゃ。家族と船で旅をしていたんじゃが、どんでもない嵐に巻き込まれてしまってのぉ。ここの港で少し休ませてくれんかい？鎖骨が痛くてかなわん...
KR: 오, 안녕하세요! 저는 올렉입니다. 가족과 함께 바다 여행 중에 끔찍한 폭풍을 만났어요. 쇄골이 너무 아픈데, 여기에서 잠시 쉬었다 가도 될까요?
FR: Bonjour ! Je m'appelle Oleg. Ma famille et moi étions en plein voyage quand nous nous sommes retrouvés pris dans une tempête. Pourrions-nous nous reposer ici ?

EN: We heard Everdale has a \qunique\q culture. Well. We'll see about that - while we teach you about the Iceberg Isles!
JP: ここエバーデールには、何やらユニークな文化があるらしいのぉ。ぜひそれを見せてくれんかい？わしも氷の島のことを教えてやろう。
KR: 에버데일만의 \q독특한\q 문화가 있다고요? 그렇다면 좀 알려주시겠어요? 대신 저희가 아이스버그 제도에 관한 몇 가지 사실을 알려드릴게요!
FR: Nous avions entendu qu'Everdale avait une culture assez unique. Mais nous ne demandons qu'à la découvrir ! Et nous pouvons vous en apprendre plus sur les Îles glacières.

EN: That settles it, we love Everdale! And my clavicle feels great. Send us home with some Everdalian goodies, would ya?
JP: ここが気に入ったよ！それに鎖骨の調子も戻ったようじゃ。何か土産が欲しいんじゃが、ちょうどいい物はあるかい？
KR: 이곳이 정말 마음에 들어요! 쇄골도 잘 치료되었고요. 아쉽지만 슬슬 집으로 돌아가야겠어요. 에버데일의 물품을 좀 가져가려고 하는데, 뭐가 좋을까요?
FR: C'est décidé. Nous adorons Everdale ! Nous nous sommes reposés et nous rentrons chargés de trouvailles.

JP: 氷の島で盛んな丸太投げを教わる
FR: Apprendre à lancer des troncs comme sur les îles

EN: Teach the famous Everdalian Stump Dance
JP: エバーデールの名物ドッスンダンスを教える
FR: Montrer la danse traditionnelle des souches

EN: Recount the history of Everdalian Salted Herring
JP: エバーデール伝統のニシンの塩漬けについて語る
KR: 에버데일의 명물 청어 소금 절임의 역사에 대해 이야기하세요.

EN: Challenge Oleg to an arm wrestling contest!
JP: オレグと腕相撲対決をする
FR: Défier Oleg au bras de fer

JP: みんなの疲れた腕をマッサージする
KR: 모든 팔씨름 대회 참가자에게 팔 마사지를 해주세요.
FR: Massages bien mérités pour tous après les bras de fer

EN: Try Icebergian fermented sap. Woo-boy that's strong!
JP: 氷の島の発酵ドリンクを飲んでみる - あぁ不味い！もう一杯！
KR: 아이스버그의 발효 수액을 드셔보세요. 아이고, 정말 강력하네요!
FR: Goûter à la confiture de sève fermentée des îles

EN: Tour the Snowflake. What an incredible ship!
JP: スノーフレーク号を見学する - 素晴らしい船だ！

EN: Take the Icebergers on a nature hike!
JP: オレグたちをハイキングに連れていく
FR: Emmener les visiteurs faire une randonnée

EN: Oleg pulled a muscle, better wait up.
JP: 少し待つ - オレグの足がつったようだ
FR: Laisser à Oleg le temps d'admirer le paysage

EN: Try some Icebergian stretches with Oleg.
Discuss posture and back health with Oleg.
JP: 姿勢と背中の状態についてアドバイスする
KR: 올렉과 함께 올바른 자세와 척추 건강에 대해 논의하세요.
FR: Discuter avec Oleg de la nature dans la vallée

EN: Gaze upon Everdale from a tranquil hillside.
JP: 静かな丘の中腹からエバーデールを眺める
FR: Admirer Everdale du haut d'une colline

JP: 汚い言葉を教え合う
FR: Apprendre les gros mots des îles

JP: 太陽を浴びてリラックス - うーん、気持ちいい！
エバーデール料理教室を開く
FR: Donner un cours de cuisine locale

EN: Learn to make Icebergian nettle porridge... delicious?
JP: 氷の島に伝わるイラクサのお粥を作ってみる - 美味しい... かな？
KR: 아이스버그의 쐐기 죽 요리법을 배워보세요. 맛있나요?
FR: Apprendre à préparer un gruau des îles

JP: 秘密の挨拶を教える
FR: Finir la journée avec une séance musicale

EN: We can't wait to return. Consider this trade route, open! Ouch! My back!
JP: またここを訪れる日が待ち遠しいのぉ。ぜひわしらと貿易関係を結んでくれ！... ギクッ... いかん、今度は腰をやったかもしれん...
KR: 다시 돌아올 날이 기다려지는군요. 저희와의 무역을 긍정적으로 고려해 주세요. 아이고, 내 등이야!
FR: Nous avons tellement hâte de revenir ! Cette route commerciale est officiellement ouverte, cher ami !

JP: <Event lost state not found>
<Event lost state not found>
鉄鉱石の功績

EN: A new material. Fascinating! New opportunities. Riveting! New metallic compounds. Confusing?
JP: 新しい素材が発見されたぞ！これで生産できる品の幅が広がるのぉ。胸の高鳴りを抑えきれん！ただ、加工するのはなかなか難しそうじゃ...
KR: 새로운 재료. 좋아요! 새로운 기회네요. 멋져요! 그런데 금속 화합물을 만드는 건 어려울까요?
FR: Une nouvelle ressource. Fascinant ! Et toutes les nouvelles opportunités. Les nouveaux alliages. Que de possibilités !

EN: Ore could be the key to the future of our Valley. We must not take it lightly. Gather as much as you can so that we may study it in the Library.
JP: 鉄鉱石はエバーバレーの未来を変える素材となるやもしれん。決して軽く考えるでないぞ！図書館で研究を進めるために、できるだけ集めてきてくれ！
KR: 광석은 에버밸리의 미래를 여는 열쇠가 될 수 있습니다. 가볍게 여길 것이 아니죠. 도서관에서 연구할 수 있도록 최대한 많은 광석을 모으세요.
FR: Le minerai pourrait bien être la clé du futur pour la vallée. C'est une opportunité à ne pas manquer. Obtenez-en autant que possible pour que nous puissions l'étudier.

EN: The time has come to experiment. Send me your finest researchers and make sure they arrive with rolled up sleeves.
JP: さあ、実験を始めるぞ！最高の研究者たちを呼んでくるんじゃ！気合いを入れてくるように伝えてくれよ！
KR: 실험할 시간이 왔습니다. 만반의 준비를 갖춘 최고의 연구원을 보내주세요.
FR: L'heure est venue pour quelques expériences. Envoyez-moi vos meilleurs chercheurs. Les plus motivés aussi.

EN: Hit the ore with a big hammer
JP: 鉄鉱石を大きなハンマーで叩く
FR: Utiliser un marteau pour tester le minerai

JP: 鉄鉱石を火に当てる

EN: Throw the ore in the sea for a while
JP: 鉄鉱石をしばらく海に入れる
FR: Immerger le minerai dans de l'eau de mer

EN: Try a little ore in your soup!
JP: 鉄鉱石をスープに入れてみる
FR: Essayer d'en ajouter un peu dans la soupe

EN: Ore soup was a poor choice, go lay down
JP: 少し横になる - 鉄鉱石とスープは合わないようじゃ...
KR: 광석 수프는 썩 좋은 생각이 아니었네요. 잠시 누워서 쉬세요.
FR: S'allonger une minute pour tenter de digérer la soupe

EN: Take a nap with some ore on your forehead
JP: 鉄鉱石を額に置いて昼寝をする
KR: 이마에 광석을 조금 올리고 낮잠을 자세요.
FR: Faire une sieste avec du minerai posé sur le front

EN: Visually compare ore to other metal alloys
JP: 鉄鉱石と他の合金の違いを見比べる
KR: 광석이 다른 금속 합금과 얼마나 다르게 생겼는지 비교하세요.
FR: Effectuer une comparaison du minerai avec des alliages connus

EN: Stick your nose in there and really smell that ore
JP: 鉄鉱石の臭いを近くで嗅ぐ
KR: 코를 갖다 대고 광석의 냄새를 맡아보세요.
FR: Mettre son nez tout prêt et tenter de trouver une odeur

EN: Stick a little ore in your ear and hear it out
JP: 鉄鉱石を耳に入れて音を聞いてみる
FR: Mettre l'oreille tout prêt pour voir si le minerai dit quoi que ce soit

EN: Put some ore in your hair, does it hold it up?
JP: 鉄鉱石を髪飾りにしてみる - これもアリかの...？

EN: Workshop some more wacky ore experiments
JP: 鉄鉱石を使ったヘンテコな実験をもう少し行う
KR: 이상한 광석 실험을 조금 더 해보세요.

EN: Wheel out the old industrial scale
JP: 工業用の古いはかりを持ってくる
はかりを組み立てる

EN: Weigh ore against other construction materials
JP: 鉄鉱石と他の建築素材をはかりにのせる
KR: 다른 건설 재료와 광석의 무게를 비교하세요.
FR: Peser le minerai pour le comparer à d'autres ressources

EN: And weigh ore against Bernard, the dog - for fun!
JP: 犬のバーナードものせてみる - 物は試しじゃ！
KR: 이번엔 개 버나드와 광석의 무게를 비교하세요. 그냥 재미로만요!
FR: Montrer le minerai à Bernard, ce bon toutou, au cas où il ait un avis

EN: Ore... what an exciting new resource! This will surely change Everdale for years to come.
JP: 鉄鉱石... なんて奥が深い素材なんじゃ。エバーデールには間違いなく明るい未来が待っておるな！
KR: 광석... 정말 흥미로운 새 자원이에요! 확실히 앞으로 몇 년 동안 에버데일을 변화시킬 거예요.
FR: Le minerai... Quelle grande nouveauté ! Everdale va changer à jamais après une telle découverte.

JP: <Event lost state not found>
<Event lost state not found>
鉄鉱石で行こうぜい

EN: Bigs´s been building with wood since his early days of professional development. Can iron ore compete? You be the judge.
JP: 俺は建設の道に入ってからというもの、木材しか扱ったことがないんだが、鉄鉱石っていうのは素材としてどうなんだ？判断はあんたに任せるよ。
KR: 빅스는 개발 일을 시작할 때부터 쭉 목재를 사용해 건축해 왔습니다. 철광석도 쓸만할까요? 직접 알아보세요.
FR: Nous construisons depuis toujours avec le bois. Mais peut-être que le minerai pourrait nous ouvrir de nouvelles possibilités ? À vous de voir.

EN: Give Bigs your finest timber. And your most... ore-like ore? I don't know. This is all new to me. Nobody tells Bigs anything.
JP: 最高の木材と、言うなれば最鉱の鉄鉱石を用意してきてくれ... とはいえ、初めて扱う代物だからな。正直なところ、素材の質は俺にも判断がつかん。
KR: 빅스에게 최고의 목재를 선물하세요. 당신이 발견한 광석도 함께요. 글쎄요, 저도 잘 모르겠네요. 빅스에겐 아무 것도 알려주지 마세요.
FR: Commençons par trouver le meilleur bois possible. Et du minerai. À quoi ressemble du bon minerai ? Je n'y connais rien du tout.

EN: In Bigs´ experience, load testing is best suited to building hyper real sculpture. Let´s construct two Platurtles and see which wins out.
JP: 俺の経験から言うと、素材の質を確かめるには模型作りが一番なんだ。2つの素材でカメっぴーを作って、どっちが優秀か見てみようぜ！
KR: 빅스의 경험에 따르면 부하 테스트는 인형을 만드는 데 가장 적합합니다. 플라터틀 2개를 구성하고 누가 이기는지 봅시다.
FR: Selon mon expérience, le plus fiable est de tester la résistance. Construisons deux Tortupentues identiques pour voir laquelle tiendra le mieux.

JP: 木を削ってカメっぴーの頭のパーツを作る
FR: Sculpter une tête de Tortupentue en bois

JP: 木を削ってカメっぴーの身体のパーツを作る
FR: Sculpter un corps de Tortupentue en bois

JP: 木を削ってカメっぴーの脚のパーツを作る
FR: Sculpter des pattes de Tortupentue en bois

JP: 木を削ってカメっぴーの甲羅のパーツを作る
FR: Sculpter une carapace de Tortupentue en bois

JP: 鉄鉱石を削ってカメっぴーの頭のパーツを作る
FR: Sculpter une tête de Tortupentue en minerai

JP: 鉄鉱石を削ってカメっぴーの身体のパーツを作る
FR: Sculpter un corps de Tortupentue en minerai

JP: 鉄鉱石を削ってカメっぴーの脚のパーツを作る
FR: Sculpter des pattes de Tortupentue en minerai

JP: 鉄鉱石を削ってカメっぴーの甲羅のパーツを作る
FR: Sculpter une carapace de Tortupentue en minerai

JP: 木のカメっぴーの模型を鑑賞する
鉄鉱石のカメっぴーの模型を鑑賞する

EN: Critically assess the artfulness of the wood sculpture
JP: 木の模型の芸術性を客観的に評価する
FR: Évaluer les qualités artistiques de la sculpture en bois

EN: Critically assess the artfulness of the ore sculpture
JP: 鉄鉱石の模型の芸術性を客観的に評価する
FR: Évaluer les qualités artistiques de la sculpture en minerai

EN: Spend hours lost in materials related thought
JP: 2つの素材についてあれこれ考える - 迷走してきたな...
KR: 충분한 시간을 들여 재료에 관해 심사숙고하세요.
FR: Réfléchir pendant plusieurs heures aux matériaux utilisés

JP: 人を集める

EN: Take a show-of-hands vote from the crowd
JP: 挙手制で決を採る

EN: In Bigs´ professional opinion, wood is more versatile but ore is sturdier. But Platurtle can't seem to make up her mind.
JP: 建設のプロとして意見を言わせてもらうなら、木は使い勝手が良いが、鉄鉱石の方が頑丈ってところか。カメっぴーも様子を見に来たようだが、やはり良し悪しの判断は難しいらしい。
KR: 빅스의 전문가적인 의견으로는 목재는 여러 용도로 쓰기 좋지만 광석의 견고함은 이길습니다. 하지만 플라터틀은 좀처럼 결정을 내리지 못하는 것 같네요.
FR: On dirait que le bois est plus versatile, tandis que le minerai est très résistant. Mais la Tortupentue n'est pas sûre de laquelle elle préfère.

JP: <Event lost state not found>
<Event lost state not found>
聖なる木の祭典

EN: Greetings and salutations fellow tree child. Sing. Dance. Bring in the new with our Festival for the Sacred Tree. Peeeace.
JP: 皆さん、ごきげんいかがかな？今日は歌って踊って、聖なる木の祭典を思いっきり楽しもうじゃないか！ラブ＆ピース！
KR: 나무에게 인사를 전하고 노래하며 춤추세요. 신성한 나무를 위한 페스티벌을 위해 뭔가 새로운 것을 시도해 봅시다.
FR: Salutations, enfant des arbres ! Chantez, dansez, fêtez le renouveau pendant le festival de l'arbre sacré. Ooooohm...

EN: Like trees change color with the seasons, so must we - with technicolor robes, galore! Good people! Bring to me your finest dyes!
JP: 季節の中で木々が葉の色を変えるように、我々も変化を遂げねばならない。色とりどりのローブに着替えるとしよう！皆、最高の染料を持ってきてくれ！
KR: 계절에 따라 나무의 색이 변하듯 우리도 변화가 필요합니다! 풍성한 총천연색의 가운과 함께요! 당신들이 가진 최고의 염료를 가져다 주시겠어요?
FR: Les arbres changent de couleur avec les saisons, et nous devons changer avec eux. Apportez-moi tous vos plus beaux vêtements !

EN: Celebrate with us! Celebrate the trees! The trees! The treeeeees!
JP: 聖なる木を賛美して一緒に祝おう！おお、木の恵みよ！
KR: 저희와 함께 나무를 찬양해요! 나무! 나아아아무!
FR: Fêtez avec nous ! Célébrez les arbres ! Les arbres ! Les aaaaaaaarbres !

EN: Roll in the grass with Captain Nicholas
JP: キャプテン・ニコラスと一緒に芝生でゴロゴロする
FR: Se rouler dans l'herbe avec le capitaine Nicholas

EN: Whisper sweet nothings to each other
JP: 互いに甘い言葉を掛け合う
聖なる木の周りで踊る

EN: Craft a garland from wild flowers
JP: 野花で花冠を作る
FR: Fabriquer une guirlande de fleurs sauvages

JP: 葉っぱを顔に擦り付ける
FR: Se frotter le visage avec des feuilles

EN: Climb to the top of the Sacred Tree
JP: 聖なる木のてっぺんに登る
FR: Grimper tout en faut de l'arbre sacré

EN: Climb back down the Sacred Tree
JP: 地面に下りる

EN: Ask Nicholas why the tree is so sacred
JP: ニコラスに聖なる木の由来を聞く
FR: Demander à Nicholas pourquoi l'arbre est sacré au fait

EN: Regret your decision as he talks for hours
JP: 後悔する - 話は永遠と続くようだ...
KR: 몇 시간 동안 대답하는 니콜라스를 보며 질문한 것을 후회하세요.
FR: Écouter les explications de Nicholas pendant les heures qui suivent

EN: Back away from Nicholas toward the snacks
JP: ニコラスから遠ざかり、露店の方へ向かう
FR: Profiter d'une distraction pour laisser Nicholas

EN: Lose Nicholas in a throng of revelers
JP: 人込みに入ってニコラスを撒く

EN: Catch your breath, Nicholas is still out there
JP: ちょっと一息 - でも、まだニコラスはどこかにいるはず...
KR: 숨을 돌리세요, 니콜라스가 아직 근처에 있답니다.
FR: Reprendre son souffle et se demander quoi faire

JP: 樹液が入ったお茶を飲んでみる

EN: Spot Nicholas in the crowd, slip out back
JP: ゆっくりその場を離れる - まずい、ニコラスだ！
KR: 군중 속에서 니콜라스를 발견했어요. 뒤로 빠져나오세요.
FR: Se laisser emporter par la foule, qui s'élance, et qui danse...

EN: Spy Nicholas explaining tree history to himself
JP: 聖なる木の歴史について呟いているニコラスを盗み見する
KR: 혼자서 나무의 역사에 대해 설명하는 니콜라스를 훔쳐보세요.
FR: Retomber sur Nicholas qui ne s'est pas arrêté de parler

EN: Psych yourself out and approach him again
JP: 意を決してニコラスに近づく
KR: 스스로에게 최면을 걸고 다시 니콜라스에게 다가가세요.
FR: Hocher de la tête avec un air sérieux

EN: Listen to the rest of his tree lecture...
JP: 聖なる木に関する長話を黙って聞く...

EN: Dance around the tree the other way around
JP: さっきとは逆回りに移動しながら木の周りで踊る
KR: 나무 주위에서 춤추세요. 아까와는 반대 방향으로요!
FR: Danser autour du l'arbre, dans l'autre sens

EN: That tree sap tea goes hard, get some more
JP: 樹液が入ったお茶をもう一度飲みに行く - なかなかイケるかも
KR: 나무 수액 차의 효과가 굉장하네요. 조금 더 드세요.
FR: Reprendre une bonne tasse de thé

EN: Watch the sun set behind the Sacred Tree
JP: 聖なる木に夕日がかかる様子を眺める
みんなと抱き合う
FR: Remercier tout le monde pour une magnifique journée !

EN: I must express my gratitude! We are, how you say, \qpartied out.\q But we will return, and with our trade goods. Fare thee well, tree child.
JP: もう感謝の言葉も出ない！これ以上ないくらい楽しかったよ！私たちも、お祭りで少しはっちゃけすぎたかな。今日はこれで失礼するけど、次回も必ず良いアイテムを持って訪問するよ。それじゃ、ごきげんよう！
KR: 정말 고맙다는 말을 꼭 하고 싶어요! 그 뭐라고 했죠, 아! \q아주 하얗게 불태웠어요.\q 무역품과 함께 꼭 돌아올게요. 잘 있거라, 나무여!
FR: Je vous suis infiniment reconnaissant ! Quel événement incroyable ! Nous allons pouvoir rentrer avec plein de souvenirs à raconter. À très bientôt, enfant des arbres.

JP: <Event lost state not found>
<Event lost state not found>

EN: You can't invite more players because Valley is full.
JP: 定員一杯のため、これ以上招待できません。
KR: 에버밸리의 정원이 가득 차 플레이어를 초대할 수 없습니다.
FR: Vous ne pouvez pas inviter plus de joueurs : la vallée est déjà pleine.

EN: You have exceeded the amount of personal invites you can create. Change your Valley access type to \qRequest to Join\q or try again tomorrow.
JP: 送信できる招待の数が上限に達しました。エバーバレーのタイプを「承認制」にするか、また明日お試しください。
KR: 개인 초대 수를 초과했습니다. 에버밸리 가입 유형을 \q가입 요청\q으로 변경하거나 내일 다시 시도하세요.
FR: Vous avez créé trop d'invitations personnelles. Modifiez l'accès à la vallée pour recevoir des demandes, ou veuillez patienter jusqu'à demain.

EN: There was an error. Please try again later.
JP: エラーが発生しました。しばらく待ってから再度お試しください。
KR: 오류가 발생했습니다. 나중에 다시 시도해 주세요.
FR: Une erreur s'est produite. Veuillez réessayer plus tard.

JP: エバーバレーへの参加を申請
<PLAYER_NAME>からエバーバレーへの参加申請が届きました。
FR: <PLAYER_NAME> a demandé à rejoindre votre vallée.

EN: You need to be elder to respond to requests.
JP: 対応するには長老である必要があります。
FR: Seuls les anciens peuvent répondre aux demandes.

JP: <RESPONDER_NAME>によって申請が承認されました
FR: La demande a été acceptée par <RESPONDER_NAME>.

JP: <RESPONDER_NAME>によって申請が拒否されました
FR: La demande a été refusée par <RESPONDER_NAME>.

JP: 承諾
拒否

EN: Your XP is too low to join this Valley.
JP: 経験値が足りないため参加できません。
FR: Vous n'avez pas assez d'EXP pour rejoindre cette vallée.

EN: Cannot join, Valley set to closed.
JP: 非公開のため参加できません。
FR: Impossible de rejoindre la vallée. Elle est fermée.

JP: 定員一杯のため参加できません。
KR: 가입 불가: 에버밸리의 정원이 가득 찼습니다.
FR: Impossible de rejoindre la vallée. Elle est pleine.

EN: Your reputation is too low to join this Valley.
JP: 評判ポイントが足りないため参加できません。
FR: Vous n'avez pas une assez bonne réputation pour rejoindre cette vallée.

JP: デコレーションクリスタル
あと<TIME>購入可能
鉄の釘

EN: Iron nails from the Blacksmith. Used for building or trading.
JP: 鍛冶屋で生産できる鉄の釘。建設や貿易の際に使用できます。
KR: 대장간에서 만든 쇠못입니다. 건설이나 거래에 사용됩니다.
FR: Clous en fer du forgeron. Pour la construction et le commerce.

JP: 強化板

EN: Reinforced plank from the Blacksmith. Used for building or trading.
JP: 鍛冶屋で生産できる強化板。建設や貿易の際に使用できます。
KR: 대장간에서 만든 강판입니다. 건설이나 거래에 사용됩니다.
FR: Planche renforcée du forgeron. Pour la construction et le commerce.

JP: 鉄の彫刻

EN: Iron sculpture from the Blacksmith. Used for trading.
JP: 鍛冶屋で生産できる鉄の彫刻。貿易品としてトレード可能。
KR: 대장간에서 만든 철 조각상입니다. 건설이나 거래에 사용됩니다.
FR: Sculpture en fer du forgeron. Pour le commerce.

JP: 卵の壺漬け

EN: Pickled eggs from the Preservery. Mmm-mm. Used for trading.
JP: 保存食屋で生産できる卵の壺漬け。美味しそう！貿易品としてトレード可能。
KR: 보존 식품 주방에서 만든 달걀 절임입니다. 맛있겠죠? 거래에 사용됩니다.
FR: Œufs vinaigrés de la conserverie. Pour commercer.

JP: 朧の谷の開発

EN: To unlock this Research Share, strengthen your trade relationship by trading with the Glimmering Dales.
JP: 朧の谷と貿易を行い、開発トレードをアンロックしましょう。
KR: 글리머링 데일즈와 무역해 연구 교환을 잠금 해제하세요.
FR: Débloquez l'échange de recherches en commerçant avec les Marches scintillantes.

JP: 参加

EN: You have too many votes ongoing.
JP: 進行中の投票が多すぎます。
FR: Vous avez trop de votes en cours.

JP: エバーバレーの設定は変更されませんでした。
FR: Aucun paramètre de la vallée n'a été modifié.

JP: 変更をキャンセルしますか？

EN: Valley setting changes have not been saved. Do you want to cancel your changes?
JP: エバーバレーの設定変更が保存されませんでした。変更をキャンセルしますか？
KR: 에버밸리 설정 변경이 저장되지 않았습니다. 변경을 취소할까요?
FR: Les paramètres de la vallée n'ont pas été enregistrés. Voulez-vous annuler les changements ?

JP: チャットのメッセージを表示
チャットのメッセージを非表示
エバーバレーのイベントを表示
FR: Montrer les événements de la vallée

JP: エバーバレーのイベントを非表示
FR: Cacher les événements de la vallée

JP: 鍛冶屋スピードブースト
期限切れ

EN: You need Elders in a Valley
JP: エバーバレーには長老が必要です
FR: Il vous faut des anciens dans une vallée.
DE: Du brauchst Älteste in deinem Tal

JP: グランドアカデミーの開発

EN: To unlock this Research Share, strengthen your trade relationship by trading with the Highland Academy.
JP: グランドアカデミーと貿易を行い、開発トレードをアンロックしましょう。
KR: 하이랜드 아카데미와 무역해 연구 교환을 잠금 해제하세요.
FR: Débloquez l'échange de recherches en commerçant avec l'Académie de Haut-Vent.

JP: 常夏の森の開発

EN: To unlock this Research Share, strengthen your trade relationship by trading with the Summery Woods.
JP: 常夏の森と貿易を行い、開発トレードをアンロックしましょう。
KR: 서머리 우즈와 무역해 연구 교환을 잠금 해제하세요.
FR: Débloquez l'échange de recherches en commerçant avec le Bois Ensoleillé.

EN: Increase the iron ingot capacity of your <BUILDING>.
JP: <BUILDING>の鉄の延べ棒の収容量を増加します。
FR: Augmentez la capacité en minerai de fer des bâtiments suivants :<BUILDING>.

JP: <BUILDING>をレベルアップ
製錬所

EN: If you´ve been down to the beach lately, you may have noticed some visitors from the <cffB93B8F>Iceberg Isles</c>.
JP: 最近浜辺に行ってる？<cffB93B8F>氷の島</c>からお客さんが来てることに気づいた？
KR: 최근에 해변에 갔다면 <cffB93B8F>아이스버그 제도</c>에서 온 방문객을 본 적이 있을 거예요.
FR: En visitant la plage, vous avez sans doute remarqué que nous avons des visiteurs en provenance des <cffB93B8F>Îles glacières</c>.

EN: The big hairy guys who smell like fish?
JP: 魚臭い毛むくじゃらの大男たちのこと？
KR: 생선 냄새를 풍기는 덩치 큰 털보들 말인가요?
FR: Les grands costaux qui sentent le poisson ?

EN: Yes ma´am! Despite their odor, they´re proficient traders with huge deposits of <cffB93B8F>iron ore</c>! Ore we need to modernize our aging economy.
JP: その通りよ！匂いのことはひとまず置いといて... 彼らは大量の<cffB93B8F>鉄鉱石</c>を取り扱う優秀なトレーダーなの。私たちもどうにか貿易関係を結んで、この疲弊した経済を救わなきゃ。
KR: 네, 맞아요! 냄새는 좀 나지만 대량의 <cffB93B8F>철광석</c>을 취급하는 우수한 무역업자들이랍니다! 함께 거래해서 경제를 살려야 해요.
FR: Ne vous fiez pas à l'odeur. Ce sont des marchands expérimentés dont les cales regorgent de <cffB93B8F>minerai de fer</c>. Si nous voulons nous moderniser, c'est ce qu'il nous faut.

EN: Jill, I didn´t realize you were such a financial expert!
JP: ジルが経済に詳しいなんて知らなかったわ！
KR: 질, 당신이 이렇게나 경제에 식견이 높은 줄 몰랐어요!
FR: Jill, je ne savais pas que vous vous intéressiez aux dernières technologies.

EN: I dabble. Get down there and make them fall in love with Everdale. I have 9,824 backlogged tasks to file by hand. Unless you´d rather do that?
JP: ちょっとかじってるだけよ。そんなことより、早く浜辺に行ってエバーデールの魅力を熱弁してきなさい！私は9,824件ものタスクを抱えてるの。それとも、あなたがやってくれるわけ？
KR: 제가 좀 잘 알죠. 그럼 이제 해변으로 가서 에버데일의 매력을 좀 알려주고 오세요. 저는 해야 할 일이 좀 많거든요. 9,824개 정도?! 아니면 저 대신 일하실래요?
FR: C'est un sujet tout à fait passionnant. Bref, allez les voir et faites-leur découvrir Everdale. Notre avenir en dépend !

JP: そ、そうね... とりあえず行ってくるわ！

EN: We did it! We scored <cffB93B8F>Iceberg Isles</c> as a <cffB93B8F>trading partner</c>! Now we can get all the <cffB93B8F>iron ore</c> we´ll ever need.
JP: やったわ！<cffB93B8F>氷の島</c>が<cffB93B8F>貿易関係</c>を結んでくれるって！これからは、<cffB93B8F>鉄鉱石</c>が思う存分手に入るわよ！
KR: 우리가 해냈습니다! <cffB93B8F>아이스버그 제도</c>를 <cffB93B8F>무역 파트너</c>로 만들었어요! 이제 필요한 만큼의 <cffB93B8F>철광석</c>을 충분히 얻을 수 있습니다.
FR: Nous avons réussi ! Les <cffB93B8F>Îles glacières</c> ont accepté de devenir notre <cffB93B8F>partenaire commercial</c> officiel ! Nous allons pouvoir obtenir le <cffB93B8F>minerai</c> dont nous avons besoin.

JP: 鉄鉱石... それはあなたの功績なの？
FR: Ce n'était pas de la tarte.

EN: We did. That´s what I said.
JP: もちろん、みんなの協力もあったけどね。
FR: Mais vous verrez, ça vaut le coup.

JP: 鉄鉱石... 結構ウソだったりして？
FR: Vous voulez dire, ça vaut le minerai...

EN: Yes? Jill, did you hit your head?
JP: ねえジル、頭でも打ったの？

EN: Never mind. Good job. Visit the harbor if you´d like to change trading partners in the future.
JP: もう忘れて。よくやったわね。港に行けば、貿易相手を変更できるわ。
KR: 하하, 아니에요. 잘 했어요. 나중에 무역 파트너를 바꾸고 싶어진다면 항구를 방문하세요.
FR: Enfin, bien joué ! Si vous vous rendez au port, vous pourrez changer de partenaire.

EN: Do you want me to call a doctor? Are you experiencing dizziness or nausea?
JP: お医者さんを呼んだほうがいいんじゃないかしら？めまいとか吐き気はしない？
KR: 의사 좀 불러 드릴까요? 어디 어지럽거나 속이 안 좋다거나 하면 말해요.
FR: Bon, après toutes ces émotions, un petit goûter ne serait pas de trop. Jill, ça vous dit ?

JP: いいからもう行って。
FR: Ah, oui, tiens. Ça ne serait pas de refus.

JP: 大丈夫ならいいんだけどね。

EN: We´re hosting another <cffB93B8F>trading partner</c> at the beach. <cffB93B8F>Summery Woods</c> people might be weird hippies, but... they have <cffB93B8F>potion ingredients</c>.
JP: 浜辺に新しい<cffB93B8F>貿易相手</c>が来てるみたい。<cffB93B8F>常夏の森</c>の人たちはヒッピー系の変わり者が多いそうだけど、<cffB93B8F>ポーションの材料</c>を持ってきてくれてるわ。
KR: 해변에서 또 다른 <cffB93B8F>무역 파트너</c>가 있습니다. <cffB93B8F>서머리 우즈</c> 사람들은 좀 특이한 히피족일지 모르지만... 그들은 <cffB93B8F>물약 재료</c>를 갖고 있습니다.
FR: Il y a un nouveau <cffB93B8F>partenaire commercial</c> sur la plage. Le <cffB93B8F>Bois Ensoleillé</c>est plein de hippies, mais ils sont très doués pour faire pousser des <cffB93B8F>ingrédients de potion</c>.

EN: Ah yes. They are known to have a diverse potion ingredient portfolio, making them a valued, long term fiscal partner.
JP: 彼らの土地では色んなポーションの材料がとれるからね。長期的な貿易関係が築ければ、有益なファイナンシャルパートナーになってくれるはずよ。
KR: 맞아요. 다양한 물약 재료를 갖고 있는 것으로 알려져 있죠. 장기적인 무역 관계를 구축한다면 유익한 재정 파트너가 될 거예요.
FR: Ah, oui. C'est vrai qu'ils ont une variété d'ingrédients sans comparaison. Ils sont des partenaires financiers très précieux.

EN: Look at you! You've gotten great at this!
JP: やっぱり経済といえばジルよね！
FR: Hahahaha, vous nous sortez les grands mots ?

EN: It took me 72 hours to learn the term: \qfiscal partner.\q
JP: 私なんか「ファイナンシャルパートナー」って言葉を学ぶのに、72時間もかかったわ。
FR: J'ai étudié des manuels d'économie ces trois derniers jours.

EN: *Sigh* Just get down there and make sure they´re happy, we need the business.
JP: はぁ... とにかく、浜辺に行って客人たちを楽しませてあげなさい。エバーデールにはこの貿易関係が不可欠なの。
KR: 어휴, 그럼 이제 해변으로 가서 그들을 즐겁게 해주세요. 우리에겐 비즈니스가 필요해요.
FR: Ah... Ça a l'air passionnant. Bien ! Si on allait voir si nos partenaires ont besoin de quelque chose ?

JP: <cffB93B8F>私はエコノミストよ！</c>
FR: Il faudrait peut-être que plus de gens se mettent à l'<cffB93B8F>économie</c>. Enfin, moi je dis ça...

EN: I didn´t think you could pull it off. But you´ve <cffB93B8F>scored</c> the <cffB93B8F>Summery Woods</c> as a <cffB93B8F>trade partner</c>. I'm impressed. Confused, but impressed.
JP: まさか、本当にやってのけるとは思わなかったけど、<cffB93B8F>常夏の森</c>との<cffB93B8F>貿易関係</c>を<cffB93B8F>締結</c>できたようね。少し耳を疑ったとはいえ、本当によくやったわ。
KR: 경제학자까지는 아닌 것 같은데요. 그래도 <cffB93B8F>서머리 우즈</c>를 <cffB93B8F>무역 파트너</c>로 <cffB93B8F>획득</c>했군요. 정말 감동이에요. 조금 혼란스럽지만, 그래도 잘 했어요.
FR: Je n'aurais jamais cru que vous y arriveriez ! Le <cffB93B8F>Bois Ensoleillé</c> a accepté de devenir notre <cffB93B8F>partenaire commercial</c>. C'est très impressionnant !

EN: What can I say? I have a way with people.
JP: 私、結構人付き合いは上手い方なのよ。
KR: 제가 사람을 좀 다를 줄 알죠.
FR: Maman m'a toujours dit que j'avais un don avec les gens.

EN: Now we can trade for <cffB93B8F>potion ingredients</c> whenever we want. Otto has lost his grip on the moss, raven feather and seashell economy.
JP: とにかく、これで<cffB93B8F>ポーションの材料</c>がいつでも手に入るようになったわ。最近じゃオットーも、コケやカラスの羽根、貝殻なんかの調達に苦労してるようだからね。
KR: 이제 우리는 원할 때마다 <cffB93B8F>물약 재료</c>를 구할 수 있습니다. 이제 오토가 이끼나 까마귀 깃털, 조개껍데기를 구하기 어려워지겠군요.
FR: Nous pourrons obtenir des <cffB93B8F>ingrédients de potion</c> quand nous voudrons. C'est la fin du monopole d'Otto !

EN: Plus, you can always visit the <cffB93B8F>Harbor</c> if you want to <cffB93B8F>switch out</c> Summery Woods for a <cffB93B8F>different trading partner</c>. Ahoy, Carolina!
JP: それと、<cffB93B8F>貿易相手</c>を常夏の森から<cffB93B8F>変更</c>したい時は、<cffB93B8F>港</c>に来ることを忘れないでね。それじゃあね！
KR: 그리고 <cffB93B8F>서머리 우즈</c> 대신에 <cffB93B8F>다른 무역 파트너</c>로 <cffB93B8F>변경</c>하고 싶다면 언제든지 항구를 방문할 수 있습니다. 어이, 캐롤라이나!
FR: Si vous vous rendez au <cffB93B8F>port</c>, vous pourrez <cffB93B8F>changer</c> de <cffB93B8F>partenaire commercial</c>. Ohé, Carolina !

JP: またねジル！

EN: Grab a quick jolt of research progress.
JP: 研究を少しだけお手伝いします。

潤沢な資源。研究三昧。

JP: 開発パック
研究をどんどん進めましょう！

EN: Be the fish you want to see in the world.
JP: 世界の大物になりましょう！
KR: 온 세상이 원하는 최고의 생선이 되렴.
FR: Pour un poisson unique en son genre.

JP: 陶芸家パック
成功への道を彫り進めましょう！
FR: Il n'y a qu'une seule route pour atteindre le succès.

JP: 木こりパック

EN: You're a lumberjack and you're okay!
JP: 木こりになれば、怖いものはありません！
FR: Pour faire plaisir au bûcheron de votre cœur.

アウトドアの世界を満喫しましょう！

EN: Prune all day. Prune all night.
JP: これで昼夜を問わずお花を手入れできます！
冒険家パック

コスチュームパーティー
3つの新しい衣装などが手に入ります。かっこよく着こなしましょう！
KR: 세 가지의 새로운 의상을 비롯해 즐길 거리 한가득!

JP: 染料セット
世界に彩りを与えましょう！

JP: 便利なアイテムで村を発展させましょう！

FR: Échange de recherche des Marches scintillantes

JP: 朧の谷と貿易を行い、開発トレードをアンロックしましょう。
KR: 글리머링 데일즈와 무역해 연구 교환을 잠금 해제하세요.
FR: Débloquez l'échange de recherches en commerçant avec les Marches scintillantes.

EN: To unlock this Research Share, strengthen your trade relationship by trading with the Highland Academy.
JP: グランドアカデミーと貿易を行い、開発トレードをアンロックしましょう。
KR: 하이랜드 아카데미와 무역해 연구 교환을 잠금 해제하세요.

EN: To unlock this Research Share, strengthen your trade relationship by trading with the Summery Woods.
JP: 常夏の森と貿易を行い、開発トレードをアンロックしましょう。
KR: 서머리 우즈와 무역해 연구 교환을 잠금 해제하세요.
FR: Débloquez l'échange de recherches en commerçant avec le Bois Ensoleillé.

JP: アップデート情報！

EN:
The new update is HERE, with a boatload of new content.
A new trading partner! A new cow! Chocolate, and more!

For this update, we wanted to add a ton of new content to keep things nice and spicy, especially in the late game.

The introduction of the Prairie Plains trade relation brings along both a new skill to master at the Guilds with Animal Handling, in addition to a brand new resource: cacao beans!

Use animal handling to speed up production on products like honey and eggs, while tending to your new mammalian friend, the cow!

Why grow cacao beans if you have nothing to make? We've introduced the Chocolate Maker and Valley Candy Shop so you can produce delectable and desirable treats. Everdale's diet will never be the same.

But that's not even close to everything we're adding. We're a good paragraph in and I still haven't even mentioned the Silk Field, Silk Weaver and Spoolmaker! Things are about to get smooth up in here.

And for you advanced players? We're bringing in an 11th villager. The more the merrier, eh?.

 Then, of course, it wouldn’t be an update without tons of balance changes and bug fixes. Thank you for playing, and see you in the Valley!

Love,
The Everdale Team
Roughly as huggable as an actual cat.
A green tribute to the great Birdog.
Realistic, but not so realistic that the dog chases it.
Where does the garden end and the house begin?

JP: 豪華な庭
壮大な庭園の出入口。
道

EN: A lamp really ties the tea party together.
The perfect surface for pots, cakes and cups.
Kick back and relax for tea time.
Plenty for everyone on the cake rack.
Flowers in your tea. Flowers in your pot.

JP: 豪華な庭
壮大な庭園の出入口。

EN: It's always tea time in a tea party house.
We got a gobblefish here! We got a gobblefish here... I'm gonna need hazard pay for this.
Here's what to do with a gobblefish: feed that chonker until he decides he's finished. Hey, at least gobblefish tip big!
Jeez, is he still hungry? The thing's an undersea trashcan. Just feed him anything nearby. Maybe he won't know the difference.
How much can any single thing eat? I think we're about to find out. Just chuck in whatever you got.
The gobblefish has officially tapped out! Now, let's fish up that treasure he left behind!
Oh no... he's still hungry! And even worse... he's disappointed in us.
How could anything still be hungry after that much food? I'm impressed, not gonna lie.
He still... wants... more? We fed him half of Everdale!
That gobblefish left behind all sorts of goodies. Let's get down there and fish 'em up.
Dragging the ocean is tougher than it sounds. Lots of angles we need to cover, here. Try to keep up.
Holy moly look at what we have here.  Alright!
Looks like the tide went and washed it all away. Hope that gobblefish comes back.
We've got a gobblefish goodie pile down there. Let's take a dip.
Suit up. We're dragging some more treasure. Wonder what's down here, man...
We got more loot! Glad it was water proof.
All I got from this dive was a soggy bottom.
That gobblefish was the gift that keeps on giving. Dive! Dive! Dive!
The sea is clear. The sun is shining. It's a good day for treasure hunting.
We are in for a windfall today, people! Thank you, gobblefish!
I'm afraid that treasure is lost for good, everybody.
Yank some seaweed from the sea floor.
Is that more seaweed? Sure is! Yank it.
There is quite a lot of seaweed down here. Wow. Okay.
What's that? Could it be? That's right it's more seaweed.
Goodness gracious me, is that an underground rose bush? No, it's seaweed. Yank.
Find and eradicate every last shred of seaweed in the bay.
Chop away some sunken ship wreckage.
Construct a wooden deep diving apparatus.
Hack through decades of accumulated gobblefish trash.
Relocate sunken logs from the treasure site.
Break open that big old wooden treasure chest! Show me the booty!
Carve away the bay trench, there be gold in there!
Mine deeper into the trench. It's a big one!
Use rocks to weigh down your divers.
Break off the rocks weights so the divers can surface.
A boulder fell on some treasure. Bash through it!
I can't believe that worked. Reinforce the rafts with clay!
Dig treasure out from thick bay clay.
Get that big lump of clay out of the way! We've got treasure to dig!
Compare bay clay to land clay.
Sculpt a clay gobblefish as tribute to the greatest fish in Everdale!
Devise a treasure hauling pulley system.
Design a Gobblefish Seeking Warning System.
Spend hours tweaking the Gobblefish Seeking Warning System to perfection.
Build thick skin as the Gobblefish Seeking Warning system gets bogged down in red tape.
Chart the gobblefish's course of migration.
Map out gobblefish's treasure dump patterns.
Learn to speak a little gobblefishish, why not?
Dig up a few treasure hunting manuals. Why has Francis been hiding these?
Confront Francis about the manuals. Turns out they were in the wrong manual pile.
People of Everdale. Our famous dog breed is endangered! We have one female left. And you have a male. Do you see where I'm going with this?
Encourage your dog, Beardie, to meet our dog, Susa. I'm sure they'll get along great! But remember, if they don't, it's the end of their species. No pressure!
Oh great! They've agreed to shack up! They did mention they have some... requests. I think we can make that happen in the spirit of conservation!
Aww, they had puppies! You guys are the best. I love Everdale. Can we come back? We can't wait to trade at your harbor! G'day!
Explain the concept of endangered species to Beardie
Take a break to chase him around the wheat field
Beardie wants to fetch a rock? Sure buddy, whatever you want.
You want to steal some apples? For you? Anything.
You want a new dog house? Alright, Beardie. You got it.
Double check the dog house instructions.
You want a water fountain too? Really?
Better get some nice stone for the fountain...
Let's take a break and forage for some grub, bub.
Find some carrots in Fiona's garden.
Spend time gaming out the future with Beardie.
Help build a relationship between Beardie and Susa
Everyone's excited about cacao, but I'm not sure I get the appeal. Do you want to see what the fuss is all about?
Let's gather what we need to try cacao in as many ways possible. I'm about to put those beans through their paces!
There's just got to be something we can make with these here beans! Put on your chef's hat. We're going cookin'.
Well, I never! It turns out cacao is a terrific ingredient! I should start using it right away!
Investigate the strange kernels with a magnifying glass.
Roast a bunch of cacao beans in a pot. Is that anything?
If we build a tiny home for the cacao, maybe it will do something.
Can they can be combined with wheat? Cacaowheat?
Give a cacao bean to Birdog and watch what he does.
Press the cacao beans into a brick. New building material?
Check for any nearby trees that produce a bean like this.
Put cacao and salt in a jar, and bury it underground.
Hammer pieces of cacao into the floor and ceiling.
Look up actual recipies for cacao at the Grand Library.
Grind a few cacao beans into a fine paste.
Cut a cacao bean into tiny pieces with an axe. Hiyaa!
Wait a second. Wait a second. Cacao... and... sugar!
Build a huge mixing bowl to Maddie's precise specifcations.
Taste test in the field! One more to be sure. Aaaand one more.
As long as our villagers are working together, they'll need catering. Please, help! I'm a baking prodigy with questionable experience!
Whoa now, I'm already swamped on catering orders! But all I have are two arms and a Breadbear spirit! Could ya lend a hand?
Well I just don't know what I would have done without you. Come get special treatment at the bakery, honey! You deserve it!
Whoa, didn't see ya there! I was going to run an experiment, but my guinea pigs ran away! Whoops.. can you like, send someone to help me test?
I just need to test some experimental potions on your villagers. I'm sure they'll be fine.
Whoooa! We found a super-reaction! Your whole village is about to go REAL fast for 24 hours. Far out, man!
Drink a uniquely gross smelling potion.
Rub this potion on my hands? Okay...
Whoa, this potion's making me woozy!
Hey, this tastes alright. Another round!
Drink a potion and grow a tail.
Panic as multiple villagers grow tails.
Figure out an antidote to the tail growing potion.
Listen to Damon explain why Everdale needs tail potions.
Patiently explain to Damon that nobody needs a tail here.
Try the potion that makes everything taste different.
Drink the potion that lets you smell colors?
Try the one that turns your hair into worms! Temporarily.
Heeeey, thiiiis ooooone maaaakes thiiiings gooo sloooow.
Get to the bottom of Damon's potion making pathology.
Damon is taking a long time to explain his: Special Reserve Potion.
Hey that Special Reserve stuff is pretty good! Drink MORE.
The Special Reserve potion was way too strong for you. Take a nap.
Use the x-ray vision potion to spot pumpkin soup through the walls.
Spot a guinea pig in the corner; get after it.
Chase the guinea pig around an open field.
Question the caught guinea pig. “WHERE ARE YOUR FRIENDS HIDING?”
You made the guinea pig cry. Better work on that attitude, tough guy.
Win over the guinea pig's trust.
Follow the guinea pig around as it reveals the guinea pig hiding zones.
Assure the other guinea pigs that nothing permanent will happen to them.
Escort the guinea pigs back to the motion maker.
Alright everybody, hug and make up.
Once you've farmed for a while, you shall pick up the technique naturally. Let's give ourselves the opportunity to do just that today.
Time to get to work! You'll notice that experience in the pumpkin patch, wheat fields and other farming areas all contribute to your skills.
Nobody said farming was easy. Why don't we really put things to the test? And by we, I mean you. I am going to go drink tea.
Truly, you've done a Valley's worth of farming! When you're ready for more, come to my Guild and I can train you even further.
Fling fresh soil across the field.
Dig some holes, fill them back up.
Haul water buckets across the field... and back again.
Get bored and invent some farming games.
Hold a wheat lifting competition. That's right I said wheat lifting.
Listen to some old farmer stories.
Read about the ways of the ancient farming masters.
Clear some space for a test field.
Grow some crops in the test field.
Study how changes to the environment affect the crop.
Write about the farm in your farm journal.
Have a long, involved conversation with your crops.
Take some deep breaths and meditate on farming.
Greetings, student. My intuition says: you want your villagers to chop wood faster. If that is your wish, they must train at my mountain Guilds!
A villager must earn skill points if they want to level up! Have your villagers chop wood at the Evergrove, at individual trees or event tasks to accrue skill points.
Once your villager has earned enough skill points, they can train at my Woodcutter's Guild. That will make them faster timber-masters!
Salutations, student! For your effort, I will grant you one day of faster woodcutting. We are all learners here.
Stand on one leg on a tree stump. Don't fall!
Sleep on a pile of sticks.
Practice ax throwing for some reason.
Tell your life story to a tree.
Listen to a tree's life story.
Carve Tasha's likeness from premium mahogany.
Stand on one hand on a tree stump. Careful, now!
Hug a tree oh so tenderly.
Recall the tree's life story as you chop it down.
Say a little prayer for the tree you cut down.
Parkour from tree stump to tree stump.
Sharpen your ax until it's razor sharp.
Bench press logs until you're positively shredded.
Rub saw dust in your eyes. Ow! Ow!
Log run in the nearest body of water.
Stand on your head on a tree stump. FOCUS!
Cover yourself in bark and leaves. Be the tree.
Practice ax swinging in a safe environment.
Practice ax swinging in an unsafe environment.
Sit on a stump and think of how far you've come.
Just chop down some trees, okay?
The Grand Monument is so tall, Francis can make new discoveries across the Valley! He might see even better if he had some supplies to work with...
Bring Francis whatever he needs to maintain a lookout at the top of the Grand Monument.
Francis is on the lookout for new discoveries and unusual Valley happenings. Keep upgrading the Monument to find them!
Incredible! After being persistently developed for a very long time, the entire Grand Monument shuddered and revealed... an entrance. What could await inside?
Send villagers to explore the inside areas of the Grand Monument.
Eureka! What an astonishing discovery! History is truly an endless discovery of intellectual riches!
Split some logs to use as makeshift stairs.
Clear away some fallen rocks to proceed further.
Remove some more stone. Are those murals?
Make sure the expedition has extra supplies of pumpkin soup.
Look at the murals, they may depict ancient farming techniques!
Install some wooden beams across the passageways to help stabilize them.
Build a cart to help bring artifacts out of the ruins.
Attempt to translate the glyphs found on the walls. Uhh...
This glyph is a prophecy: Valley Sea will be the first people to uncover this find!
Study some ancient pots. They probably held... something.
Recreate the ancient pottery to learn more about the technique.
Put some more stairs into the lower areas of the ruins.
Lay down planks over muddy areas for easier access.
Examine the type of stone used here. It's very smooth...
Retrieve some sample stones in order to study later.
Assemble more soup rations, who knows how long they'll be down there.
Try to decide if the mural really depicts a farm, or something else.
Set up small research stations inside the underground area.
Build shelters so the explorers can stay inside for longer periods of time.
Wait. This mural depicts a Grand Monument!
But the one in the mural seems much, much, grander than any known monument.
Analyze the ceramic tiles that have fallen from the mural.
Help to restore damaged areas of the mural with new tile.
Cut through some roots deep below the surface so the expedition can proceed.
Whittle a small copy of a sculpture found in the ruins.
Clean out a large atrium that was filled with rocks.
Carefully dust the silt off another gigantic mural.
Gotta keep supplying the soup! It's tough, scary work down there.
Quietly develop the farm hypothesis about the mural in your head.
Bring in more tables, desks, chairs... it's not glamorous but it's important.
Study the building techniques used in the construction of these ruins.
Make some headway in translating the glyphs. "Blhpkf"? Not much headway.
Take as many notes as possible on everything you see inside.
Make clay casts of various stone inscriptions found inside for later study.
Make clay casts of various decorative motifs found inside for later study.

Francis spotted the Dance of the Spirits from his perch on the Monument. Time to cut a rug!
Spirits tend to dance in private. That makes this example all the more puzzling. Go investigate their ritual!
The spirits have become accustomed to your presence, and no longer dance in private. They like you!
The spirits did not appreciate your particular dancing skills. Don't fret. Francis will spot more spirit activity from the Monument!
Attempt the Spirit Shimmy on your own.
Let a spirit actually teach you the Spirit Shimmy.
Listen in wonder to the songs of the spirits.
Smile in awe at the spirits until they're borderline uncomfortable.
Sit quietly with a spirit as you recharge your social energy.
Build a dance floor and make sure it's sturdy.
Study the ancient Tome of Spirit Dances.
Compare your moves to the written guide, ad nauseam.
Sculpt a partner for the sculpted dancing spirit.
Try an ax dance. Why not?
Trim nearby bushes so the spirits have a place to relax.
Bash away stones to make room for more dancers.
Carve a special Dance Edition stone spirit.
Tickle the spirits with a wheat stock. Hehehe...
Stick the spirits in some dirt and see if you can grow more.
Measure the circumference of a spirit dance circle.
Francis spotted a rare spirit market from the Monument. What in Everdale are they up to?
The spirits established a marketplace, with quite the peculiar business model. They trade honey for cuddles and dances! Go shopping!
Shopping has never been this cuddly. Congrats on a successful market sojourn!
Oh, drat! The market closed before you could finish trading. Don't fret. We will spot more from the Monument, as long as we build it higher!
Do the Spirit Slide. It's the hot new spirit dance.
Gently pet a spirit on the head.
Try a magic trick. Spirits love illusions.
Trade away your hand crafted spirit houses.
Study the intricate spirit trade economy.
Calculate the precise value of a cuddle.
Offer up your handmade bee sculptures.
Just give them a big ol' handful of wet clay.
Wood you like to teach some lumber puns?
Carve spirit likenesses for a reasonable fee.
Teach pickax throwing technique. Careful, now!
Clear weeds from the market stalls.
Plant a less invasive species where the weeds were.
Teach the famous Everdalian stump dance.
Arrange a friendship garland for your favorite spirit.
Francis spotted some ancient, elderly... really, really old spirits approaching. What could they want?
The super, ultra, insanely old spirits want to impart their knowledge upon Everdale! Go learn from the geezers!
That experience was... illuminating, was it not?
When senior spirits take too long to recollect something, the thought gets away from them. It happens to everyone eventually.
Listen to that old earpuff explain how the wind works.
Watch Torchy flex his heat muscles.
Build focused desks for spirit studies.
Repair the old, broken spirit globe.
Sculpt an anatomically accurate spirit skeleton.
Sculpt clay vials to study spirit biology.
Polish up the stone owl of wisdom.
Assemble a high fiber vegetarian brunch for the attendees.
You know what. Let's verify the authenticity of the Owl of Wisdom.
Fashion lumbar supports for the ergo chairs.
Carve out some nice, sturdy lecture tables.
Dig an excavation site for spirit archaeology
Francis spotted the spirits breaking into Damon's potion shop! It looks like they headed for the hills!
The spirits drank a bunch of potions and are freaking out! Better babysit...
Potion disaster averted. Build up your monument so Francis can spot more spirit activity.
The spirits will recover... eventually. No worries. Francis will spot new spirits as long as you keep upgrading the Monument.
A confused spirit got stuck under a stone. Help them out!
Build a Chill Zone for spirits affected by Damon's “good vibes” potion experiment.
Hack a path through the forest to guide spirits to the Chill Zone.
Make some clay vials to store unpredictable potions.
Build a campfire in the Chill Zone. Cozy.
Replant some trampled flowers and herbs.
Build a little grill so the vibing spirits can have a barbecue.
Build a trippy sculpture. Spirits love trippy sculptures.
Look up mental acuity exercises for Damon.
Yeah Damon's going to need more than one mental acuity exercise.
Finn and Fiona are mad about their trampled wheat. Tidy up?
Build a tailored spirit massage chair.
Build a second conversation pit with “better vibes?”
Carve up some stumps for seating.
Rebuild Damon's messed up potion production area.
Use clay as an organic spirit exfoliate
Francis spotted a curious glade full of spirits from the Monument. What could they be up to?
The spirits want to share their favorite foraging spot with you! But they also want... competition. Can you pick more berries and mushrooms than they can?
You are a seasoned picker indeed! Francis will keep his eyes peeled for even more spirit adventures!
The spirits picked way more mushrooms than you. But don't worry, Frances will spot more spirit adventures. Keep upgrading the Monument for more!
Harness the power of berry picking.
Build some forest signs so nobody gets lost!
Make some special clay pots to store mushrooms and berries.
Learn which mushrooms are safe to eat.
Learn which mushrooms are most delicious!
A weird and alluring mushroom is growing out of that boulder. Bash it out!
Clear a walking path through the abundant berries and mushrooms.
Reveal and rebuild the entrance to the ancient mushroom cave.
Scavenge every dark corner of the ancient mushroom cave. Spooky!
Crack open that old mine shaft in the mushrooms cave.
Scythe some wheat to craft gathering baskets.
Craft some handrails to guide people through the cave. It's dark in there!
Build a cozy little mushroom outpost.
Figure out where the sweetest raspberries are growing.
Build a fabulous trophy to commemorate the winning picker!
Craft a raspberry mushroom shrine for the winner's home. Neat.
Dig a little walk way though that spooky old cave.
Dig a walk way through the spooky mine, too! Be brave, villager!
Carve “Warning: Spooky” sign outside the old cave.
Set up some cold stone berry storage for all those leftovers!
Francis spotted more spirit shenanigans from the Monument. Go have a look!
Sam the dye maker sent her chameleon, Swatch, to capture the colors of the spirits. Send some villagers to help her out!
You did it! Francis will keep his keen eye out for more spirit adventures. Upgrade the Monument to see farther and get more!
Wuh-oh, some spirits got away! And they took their colors with them! But don't fret, Francis will spot more spirit adventures – upgrade the Monument for more!
Pick some colorful wildflowers as a hue template.
Build a comfy recliner so the spirits can relax during color measurement.
Construct some easels for color testing.
Measure the color spectrum of earpuffs in sunlight.
Make some clay pots to mix colors in
Paint nice patterns on clay pottery
Clear away some trees to view spirits in perfect lighting
Build a wood fire for Torchy to mega-roast in red flame.
Try color matching some local clay.
Paint ethereal spirit patterns on clay pottery.
Assemble chopped wood along a gradient scale.
Harvest a fresh pile of wheat to compare to Birdog's fur.
Replicate the fine art of spirit stone sculpture.
Critically assess the strengths and weaknesses of an ancient spirit frieze.
Arrange your favorite wildflowers in a pretty patch.
Pick pumpkins that bear an odd resemblance to earpuffs.
Carve your findings into a commemorative tree trunk.
Sculpt yourself sculpting a vibrant spirit tribute, too.

JP: 180クリスタル

EN: Find a snack on the floor.
Give up on eating snacks and chuck carrots at Francis.
Francis has a carrot in his beard. Laugh at him.
Take cover behind some dirty old barrels.
Launch handfuls of grain at your opponents.
There's hot soup in my nose! Oh no! Ahhh!
Throw more carrots at Francis to feel better.
I love all creatures, whether they're fuzzy, slimy, creepy or crawly.
That must be why you get along with Francis the Librarian.
A <cffB93B8F>new trading partner</c> just turned up on the coast. <cffB93B8F>The Prairie Plains</c> can teach us <cffB93B8F>animal handling</c>, AND trade a <cffB93B8F>new resource, cacao beans</c>!
I'll pop down to <cffB93B8F>the coast</c> and welcome our guests! If we <cffB93B8F>nail their introduction</c>, they'll FOR SURE stick around!
You've done it again, Carolina. You've <cffB93B8F>acquired</c> the <cffB93B8F>Prairie Plains</c> as a <cffB93B8F>trading partner</c>. You are truly full of surprises; and soon, dairy products.
I knew one day my raw, animal magnetism would come in handy.
Now, if you want to learn the Prairie Plains' <cffB93B8F>animal handling skill,</c> trade with them until you've formed a strong relationship.
Once you have the <cffB93B8F>Prairie Plains Research Shares,</c> you can truly unlock the wisdom of the Plainsfolk! And <cffB93B8F>cows</c>!
Will do! Alright, I'm out. I've got a pocket full of cacao beans and no idea what to do with them.
The Blacksmith and Smelter go faster
EVERYTHING in the village goes faster
Complete this event to acquire a trade relationship with <partner>!
Complete this event to give your Valley a perk: <perk> for <duration>.
Complete this event to get your Valley <amount> Research Tokens.
Yar, there be mariners in yonder bay! Mysterious chaps they are – they say they have a treasure map! A legendary mariner treasure be hidden here, yar. Right under our feet!
Trade with the mariners for the first part of the treasure map! They need goods for their long journey 'cross the seas, yar.
Ya got the map piece! It says: “In the sandy desert west – a clue enjoys its dusty rest.” Fetch some water. We're going to the desert.
We couldn't find the map piece. Those mariners sure have a way with burying stuff. But worry not, I'm sure they'll return.
This must be the place, but where exactly do we dig? You know, some sweet tooth moles live around here. Maybe they'll help us!
Bribe the local desert moles to help you dig. They'll do just about anything for sweets.
Avast! The moles found the corner of the map! It says: “Find the map in the Northern River - so deep under water it will make you shiver.”
We couldn't find the map piece. Those mariners sure have a way with burying stuff. But worry not, I'm sure they'll return.
You found the river. The next piece must be somewhere below the surface. Dive, dive, dive!
Send your villagers to dive for the next piece of the treasure map.
Yar, ya got yet another piece of the map! It says:” hidden in the west, in the mountains up on high – you'll find a clue where you touch the sky."
We couldn't find the map piece. Those mariners sure have a way with burying stuff! But worry not, I'm sure they'll return.
Scythe away some seaweed to clear the search site.
Feed the manatees! You are searching their river, after all.
Build a warm-up station by the riverside. The divers are freezing!
Build a diving board to spice things up.
Break away that river boulder. Maybe the map is underneath it?
Carve out an entrance to the river cave. It's spelunkin' time!
Study the other map pieces again... maybe we missed something.
Dust off the old Mariner's Handbook. That sounds relevant!
Could be under that nasty old driftwood.
Sculpt clay diving helmets. They're not ideal but they work!
Fashion a clay treasure hunting progress board.
Chop up that fallen tree and get it out of the way.
The manatees are back! Entertain them and they'll help you search.
Get the fish to search, too. Fish. They never want to help on their own.
Build some clotheslines and dry off your stuff.
You found where to look next – it's on the mountain, towering over Everdale. Find a way to reach it!
Construct a lift to reach the top of the mountain. The final map piece awaits! You. Are. So. Close.
Yar, ye be a true salty dog. Ya found the final piece! Now, off to the East to dig for your well-earned treasure. Raise your glass! A toast for the treasure hunters!
We couldn't find the map piece. Those mariners sure have a way with burying stuff. But worry not, I'm sure they'll return.
We found the secret treasure nook. Man. How'd we miss this treasure? It's been RIGHT here all along.
Send villagers to gather your treasure!
Your Valley has proven to be a match for the mariners, and then some! You're drawn to treasure like flies to honey. Congrats, scalawags!
We couldn't find the map piece. Those mariners sure have a way with burying stuff. But worry not, I'm sure they'll return.
Clear away that gross algae growing on your treasure. Yuck.
Craft clay pots for your many riches.
Carve a commemorative Mariner ship model. We owe them that.
Convince your cows to help transport gold.
Dig up a nice memorial location.
Design a Mariner Wreath. Mariners. They love wreaths.
Build a treasure conveyor belt. Someone's got to move this gold.
Politely ask the manatees to pick up any spare loot.
Carve a stone mural for the Mariner's Memorial.
Chisel in the names of every villager who helped make it possible.
Count your many pieces of treasure.
Use your loot to assemble a diversified asset portfolio.
Build a gift shop next to the Mariner Memorial.
Carve tiny stone Mariner Memorial souvenirs.
Invest everything in a small, but formidable shipping corporation.
Dig yourself a new swimming pool.
Ask the matinees if they just want to like, hang out.
Panic as your new shipping corporation is grounded by termites.
Maybe there's more gold in the algae.
Re-purpose shipping wood for gift ship souvenirs.
Please. Please check the algae again.
Look, manatees I love you guys but I know you missed some gold down there.
Break rocks out of frustration. Investing is stressful.
Dig a hole so you can bury your financial dreams.
Build a sound proof room so you can cry loudly.

I might not be, like, the roundest pumpkin in the patch? But I know this: colorless rainbows only appear when there isn't enough love around for all the people in our lives who we care about. But with the Valley's help, I think we can make it good as new, ya know!?

Now, we can fix most of the rainbow with real colors from Everdale. But, we also need to do a few good deeds. We have to remind everyone that loving and accepting your neighbors is what makes the rainbow shine so bright!
Gosh. Is there anything more beautiful than a big, bright rainbow?
Sometimes the rainbow can't be fixed in time. But that's the thing about rainbows. There's always another one, isn't there?
Check out The History of Rainbows from the Great Library.
Train cattle to lead you toward red wildflowers.
Check out variations of rainbow symbolism.
Find out if dogs are color blind. ONCE AND FOR ALL.
Give a villager a hug while chopping down some redwoods.
We found a lot of red. NOYCE! But we're going to need more if we want orange. You know your color tables, right? I sure do! I think!
Sometimes the rainbow can't be fixed in time. But that's the thing about rainbows. There's always another one, isn't there?
Still need more yellow, don't we? I think you're getting the hang of this!
Sometimes the rainbow can't be fixed in time. But that's the thing about rainbows. There's always another one, isn't there?
Wheat... wheat is yellow! Close enough for me!
Say hi to your neighbors while scooping yellow clay.
Wheat for rainbows? Wheat for rainbows.
Spin a gorgeous color wheel with an old best friend.
If we build a clay rainbow, will it stand up on its own?
Time to get the green! That means more yellows, and of course: the blues.
Sometimes the rainbow can't be fixed in time. But that's the thing about rainbows. There's always another one, isn't there?
There's a whole lot of blue out there. We just need to grab it!
Sometimes the rainbow can't be fixed in time. But that's the thing about rainbows. There's always another one, isn't there?
Dig up blue amethysts and reminisce about the past.
Remind your builders that they're loved and valued.
Crack open some shimmering blue geodes.
Build a Hugging Zone end of the rainbow.
Find blue crystals deep under the Everdale mountains.
We've reached violet! Bring all kinds of white and blue and red. I can practically see it already!
Sometimes the rainbow can't be fixed in time. But that's the thing about rainbows. There's always another one, isn't there?
All the colors are back. Take it in for a moment. Because now? It's time to PARTY. Oh, you thought we were just gonna sit here? Please. This is Everdale!
Sometimes the rainbow can't be fixed in time. But that's the thing about rainbows. There's always another one, isn't there?
Bring all the animals. Cows party, too.
Roll, roll, roll in the hay!
Make some disposable clay party cups.
Are there any rainbow colors we can't see? Far out.
See who looks the best while breaking rocks.
Gaze together at the rainbow you built.
Carve a wooden rainbow from multicolored timber!

We thought all this extra sugar would cheer everyone up, but nope. One villager done saw a yeti in there and now no one will go near it! Yetis. They ruin everything.
It's clear that we gotta get rid of this here yeti. If she likes sugar this much, maybe she'll go after other sweets, too. Let's ask Maddie the Baker for help.
Maddie done helped us bake a yeti lure. First time for everything I guess. Time to bag this bigfoot. Send me your bravest villagers.
So it wasn't a yeti after all. I gotta ask, how did an earpuff get so chonky? Was unrefined sugar the yeti all along?
Hide behind a pile of wheat... yeti comin'.
Use your farming skills to spot perfect yeti hiding places.
Calculate wind speed. Yetis follow the wind, obviously.
Recall Tasha's lesson on subduing field yetis.
Scan the field faster than a yeti ever could.

Farming taking too long? Maybe it's time to hit Damon's for some potions.

Try remembering if Tasha taught you to scream at yetis or simply play dead.
Throw yeti bait to the wind.
Cover your body in freshly farmed sugar.
Sink into a pile of sugar.
Sugar crash. Just... gonna... rest my eyes... in the field...
Wait, is that her? IS THAT THE YETI?
Attempt to roll the “yeti” away from the field.
The Icebergian Committee for Ore Quality

Alright, people. Time for your annual ore inspection. Fill out forms 324c, 44b and 9372c to verify that you're following the production guidelines established by the Icebergian Committee for Ore Quality.
Form 324c. Iron bars must reach exactly 3.24667 on the patented Icebergian Iron Taste Test. Please send iron bar samples to my colleagues immediately.
Form 44b: This one's a size measurement. We need to verify that your iron products are of the allotted size as stated by the Oremaker's Union. Send over your sample products.
Form 9372c: This test is for general quality guidelines and it is VERY serious. I will personally sit on each iron product 1,000 times to verify whether or not it remains pristine.
Your iron products passed with 99.65% out of a possible 100%. I guess that's pretty good. Your certification is complete. Congratulations.
Come aboard, student. I'm about to show you how goes the fishing pros.
Fishing isn't just about catching fish. It's about spending quality time doing something you love. But in order to relax, you gotta get good.
Ahhh. Don't you feel better now? Sitting in the sun? Feeling the gentle waves? That gave me a boost. And I think it gave you a boost, too.
Assemble some rods at your own pace.
Fix up some old fishing boats. They need it.
Listen as Clarence teaches you to let go of expectations and enjoy yourself.
Get that dang kelp out of the way.

Craft small, stone anchors for your fishing boats.

Build some under dock storage. Efficiently use space, people.
Make some new clay pots to store your gear.
More kelp. Can we do something with this?

Pretend to build something while you listen to Clarence.
Understand that Clarence's interest in the potions is not really about the potions.

Make Clarence a little wooden fish as a memento.
Share a thermos of pumpkin soup with your fishing mentor.
Lift out all the anchors and set them aside.
My chameleon, Swatch, usually like, LOVES changing colors? But lately he's been blue. And won't turn anything else. Help!
How can we persuade Swatch to change colors again? The villagers have some ideas.
Swatch still hasn't changed colors, but we did succeed in determining he's more indigo than blue. To the Indigo Field!
Try to cheer up Swatch by building a little chameleon house.
...and a little chameleon play set too.
Serve Swatch a bowl of rich orange pumpkin soup.
Green? Show him different green leaves.
Add an extension to the chameleon house.
Collect more green leaves. Green is all over the place!

Say, does this color remind you of indigo?
Sculpt a likeness of Swatch out of clay, just in case we need it.
So, we failed to make Swatch change colors. But like, so what!? You know? He's indigo and I personally think that's totally awesome!
Bring us some blue, white and red things so we can mix indigo! Maybe that can, like, persuade Swatch to change colors!
Swatch is shining up like a little disco ball! He must really have a thing for indigo. Well done!
Making toys is a craft, but it's also a science, dearie. Why don't we put these toys to the test and see how fun they really are?
Let's assemble a toy collection, shall we?
You may think: “Daisy, she's a sweet old lady. She must be great with kids.” Well, you're wrong.  Gather some grown ups for the testing process.
The results... are... wonderful! It's official. These toys are indeed, fun! Why, I'm so pleased I'll speed up toy production for a day!

We tried painting the cow brown, but that didn't make our milk chocolatey at all. Could there be another way?
Maybe... if we mix the cacao with the milk, we'll get those sweet results. What do you y'all think?
I think we're about ready to fire up the chocolate milk fountain. A-Moozing results, folks! Smiles all around! The Valley Dairy is going to be running hot!
Thanks to the Prairie Plains, we can now train villagers in animal handling. This lets you assign villagers to the cow barn, chicken coop or beehive so they produce resources faster. Stupendous!

To be accepted at the prestigious Guild, you need to collect enough animal handling skill points with a villager. Earn skill points by assigning a villager to your cow barn, chicken coop or beehive. Then bring me the results.

Once you've trained a villager at my Animal Handler's Guild, they will be able to complete Animal Handling event tasks faster than before. And you can make them work faster still with Animal Handlers' potions.

Well done, student. Remember, earn skill points for your villagers and send them my way. Then they'll truly whisper to the animals, and your village will prosper like never before! Alright, ta. Tea time.
Train in the art of bovine head massage.
Learn to make bees fly in formation.

Disruption. Chaos. Beauty. That's what I do. FOR MY LIVING. And that's what we'll create with silk.
Harvest silk cocoons the Valley Silk Field. Refine the cocoons into spools and cloth in your village. And do it well. Do not disappoint me.
With silk cloth, you can tailor stunning silk items. Items that will change. Fashion. Forever.

Superb. That fashion show represented the best of Everdalian style. Get ready. Soon, everyone will want a piece of your talent. In fact, I'm so impressed, I'm granting you express service in all silk refining buildings and the silk field itself.
Faster Silk Field, Spool Maker, Weaver
